commitResults.messageTitle: Add Arnold.java with greet and exit
commitResults.messageBody:
Arnold.java houses the main Arnold  class for Arnold, our chatbot.

Arnold is the name given to differentiate from the placeholder name Duke.

The Arnold class can greet and exit the user when run.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add basic user input loop to Arnold main method
commitResults.messageBody: The program echoes user input until 'bye' is entered, at which point it prints the goodbye message and exits.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor method names for brevity in Arnold.java

commitResults.messageBody:
Standardise output indentation across the application.

This improves readability for the user.
Introduces the TaskList class implementing the singleton pattern to manage a list of tasks. Provides methods to add tasks and retrieve the singleton instance.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add method to list all tasks in TaskList
commitResults.messageBody: Introduced the listTasks() method, providing a way to retrieve and display all stored tasks.
Introduced section comments to organize helper methods and chatbot commands in Arnold.java for improved code readability.

The code is cluttered with constant reuse of the line() method. Lines are printed before and after each message.

Introduce a method for printing messages which handles styling like the horizontal lines and indents.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add handling for listing tasks and task addition
commitResults.messageBody:
As a placeholder, the main loop only echoes user input currently.

Introduce methods for handling the 'list' command and adding tasks to improve functionality.

listTasks method appends a newline character after each task. This causes the chatbot message to have an extra blank line which is not visually nice.

Avoid adding a "\n" on the last task item to solve this.

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant System.exit method when exiting
commitResults.messageBody:
The program will terminate on its own.

Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>

Make `TaskList` instance and `tasks` List<String> final for safety.

Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor line separator to use String.repeat
commitResults.messageBody: Replace the hardcoded line of underscores.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor to use Task objects for task management
commitResults.messageBody:
Introduce a Task class to encapsulate task data, state, behaviour.

Update Arnold and TaskList to use Task objects instead of raw strings, improving code structure and extensibility.

Introduce a unique incremental ID for each Task instance.

Remove redundant formatting and counter in `TaskList` class accordingly.

Command handling is starting to get convoluted in Arnold class, especially as we add arguments into the mix.

Refactor Arnold.java to delegate processing to InputProcessor class.

In other words, Arnold only needs to know how to `hi` and `run`. To perform these tasks, Arnold calls its inputProcessor.

For this change, move main method to a new Main.java file which will instruct Arnold class.
For better separation of concerns, add Messenger class which handles all printing of messages to the user interface.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move Task and TaskList classes to Tasks package

commitResults.messageBody: Introduces the InputHandlingStrategy interface and its implementations: DefaultStrategy, ExitStrategy, HiStrategy, and ListStrategy. These classes encapsulate different input handling behaviors for commands such as adding tasks, greeting, listing tasks, and exiting the application.
Introduces the InputProcessor class to handle user input commands using strategy patterns.
Add imports for input handling, task, and messaging modules

Greeting text is duplicated here even though Messenger already has a hi() method.

Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>
Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Merge branch 'refactor/strategies' of https://github.com/andrewsoonqn/ip into refactor/strategies

commitResults.messageBody:
System.exit(0) hard-terminates the JVM, which makes the chatbot hard to test/embed and prevents graceful shutdown/cleanup.

Use events to signal termination back to the main loop.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add mark and unmark methods to TaskList
commitResults.messageBody: Allow marking and unmarking tasks by their ID within the TaskList class.

Introduced MarkStrategy and UnmarkStrategy to handle marking and unmarking tasks as done or not done. These classes interact with Messenger and TaskList to update task status and provide user feedback.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor task access by ID in TaskList
commitResults.messageBody: The id of a Task corresponds directly with its position in a task list as shown to the user, i.e., 1-indexed. Add getTask(id) method to abstract this logic and error-proof code.

commitResults.messageTitle: Add mark and unmark command strategies
commitResults.messageBody: Handle 'mark' and 'unmark' commands in InputProcessor.
Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>

commitResults.messageTitle: Using whitespace regex to parse commands
commitResults.messageBody:
Splitting the normalized input with split(" ") will produce empty tokens when the user types multiple spaces (for example, "mark   1" yields commandParts[1] == ""), which then gets passed as the argument to strategies like MarkStrategy and UnmarkStrategy and leads to parsing errors. 

Use whitespace regex to make the command parsing more robust to common user input patterns.

Co-authored-by: Copilot <175728472+Copilot@users.noreply.github.com>
Prevent instantiation of Task.

Tasks handle their "convert to string" methods (with and without ids). There is room for more separation of concerns, especially as we have more subclasses.

- Introduce the TaskString utility class to handle task string formatting with and without IDs.
- Update Task, Todo, Deadline, and Event toString methods to include type prefixes ([T], [D], [E]).
- Refactor strategies and TaskList to use TaskString for consistent output formatting.

commitResults.messageTitle: Move Todo creation to a new strategy class

commitResults.messageBody: Introduce ArgParser class for parsing command arguments and flags.

commitResults.messageTitle: Refactor input parsing to use ArgParser
commitResults.messageBody: Delegate logic for separating command and argument(s).

commitResults.messageTitle: Remove redundant main method in ArgParser class
Store task description in flags map
commitResults.messageBody:
There is no way to retrieve task description.

Let's reserve "taskDescription" as a pseudo-flag in the flag to value map. This is the simplest way (to the best of my knowledge) to implement now.

This allows downstream code to access the parsed task description alongside other flags.

commitResults.messageTitle: Register strategies for deadline and event tasks
TaskList: use toString instead of listTasks

commitResults.messageBody:
Refactor DeadlineStrategy, EventStrategy, and TodoStrategy to extend AddTaskStrategy and implement only the task creation logic (the only different part), reducing code duplication and improving maintainability.

Shared behaviour will be easier to implement. e.g., displaying remaining tasks.

Change TaskList.addTask to return the added Task instead of a String.

Update AddTaskStrategy to print a more informative message.

Other changes:
- Add getSize method to TaskList for retrieving the current number of tasks.
- Move message related logic out of TaskList for better separation of concerns.

commitResults.messageTitle: Minor tweak to task string representation
Tweak usage of strip and toLowerCase methods
commitResults.messageBody:
Task descriptions and flag arguments are unintentionally converted to lowercase. Whitespace between arguments might also remain.

Fix by tweaking usage of strip and removing toLowerCase.
